actions.description: Copy a file or folder to a different location in the user's Dropbox. If the source path is a folder all its contents will be copied.
actions.name: copy

properties.description: Metadata containing details about the copied file or folder.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: The name of the copied file or folder, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The full path to the copied file or folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the path to the copied file or folder, preserving original casing.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the copied file or folder.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Metadata containing details about the copied file or folder.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: The name of the copied file or folder, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The full path to the copied file or folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the path to the copied file or folder, preserving original casing.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the copied file or folder.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Name of the file with the extension. Don't fill in if you want a folder.
properties.label: Filename
properties.name: filename

properties.description: The path which the file or folder should be copied from.  Root is /.
properties.label: Source Path
properties.name: from_path

properties.description: The path which the file or folder should be copied to.  Root is /.
properties.label: Destination Path
properties.name: to_path

actions.title: Copy

actions.description: Create a folder at a given path.
actions.name: createFolder

properties.description: Metadata containing details about the newly created folder.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: The name of the newly created folder. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The full path to the newly created folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the path to the newly created folder, preserving original casing.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID for the newly created folder within Dropbox.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Metadata containing details about the newly created folder.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: The name of the newly created folder. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The full path to the newly created folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the path to the newly created folder, preserving original casing.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID for the newly created folder within Dropbox.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The path of the new folder. Root is /.
properties.label: Folder Path/Name
properties.name: path

actions.title: Create New Folder

actions.description: Create a new .paper file on which you can write at a given path
actions.name: createTextFile

properties.description: The name of the newly created file, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The full path to the file in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the file's path, preserving original casing for readability.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the file within Dropbox.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The size of the file in bytes, representing the total amount of data it contains.
properties.name: size

properties.description: Indicates whether the file can be directly downloaded from Dropbox.
properties.name: is_downloadable

properties.description: A hash value representing the content of the file, used for verifying data integrity.
properties.name: content_hash

properties.description: The name of the newly created file, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The full path to the file in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the file's path, preserving original casing for readability.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the file within Dropbox.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The size of the file in bytes, representing the total amount of data it contains.
properties.name: size

properties.description: Indicates whether the file can be directly downloaded from Dropbox.
properties.name: is_downloadable

properties.description: A hash value representing the content of the file, used for verifying data integrity.
properties.name: content_hash

properties.description: The path of the new paper file. Root is /.
properties.label: Path
properties.name: path

properties.description: Name of the paper file
properties.label: Filename
properties.name: filename

properties.description: The text to write into the file.
properties.label: Text
properties.name: text

properties.description: If there's a conflict, as determined by mode, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid conflict.
properties.label: Auto Rename
properties.name: autorename

properties.description: Normally, users are made aware of any file modifications in their Dropbox account via notifications in the client software. If true, this tells the clients that this modification shouldn't result in a user notification.
properties.label: Mute
properties.name: mute

properties.description: Be more strict about how each WriteMode detects conflict. For example, always return a conflict error when mode = WriteMode.update and the given "rev" doesn't match the existing file's "rev", even if the existing file has been deleted.
properties.label: Strict Conflict
properties.name: strict_conflict

actions.title: Create New Paper File

actions.description: Delete the file or folder at a given path. If the path is a folder, all its contents will be deleted too.
actions.name: delete

properties.description: Metadata containing details about the deleted file or folder.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: The name of the deleted file or folder, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.

properties.description: The full path to the deleted file or folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.

properties.description: ID of the deleted file or folder.

properties.label: Path

properties.description: Name of the file. Leave empty if you want to delete a folder.

properties.name: filename

actions.title: Delete

actions.description: Get a temporary link to stream content of a file. This link will expire in four hours and afterwards you will get 410 Gone. This URL should not be used to display content directly in the browser. The Content-Type of the link is determined automatically by the file's mime type.
actions.name: getFileLink

properties.description: The name of the file, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The complete path to the file in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox account.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: A user-friendly version of the file's path, preserving the original casing for better readability.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the file within Dropbox.
properties.name: id

properties.description: A temporary URL that can be used to stream the content of the file. This link expires after four hours.
properties.name: link

properties.description: The name of the file, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The complete path to the file in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox account.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: A user-friendly version of the file's path, preserving the original casing for better readability.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the file within Dropbox.
properties.name: id

properties.description: A temporary URL that can be used to stream the content of the file. This link expires after four hours.
properties.name: link

properties.description: The path to the file you want a temporary link to.  Root is /.
properties.label: Namepath to the File
properties.name: path

properties.description: Name of the file with the extension. Needs to have a streamable extension (.mp4, .mov, .webm, ect)
properties.label: Filename
properties.name: filename

actions.title: Get File Link

actions.title: List Folder

actions.description: Move a file or folder to a different location in the user's Dropbox. If the source path is a folder all its contents will be moved. Note that we do not currently support case-only renaming.
actions.name: move

properties.description: Metadata containing details about the moved file or folder.
properties.name: metadata

properties.description: The name of the moved file or folder, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.

properties.description: The full path to the moved file or folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.

properties.description: The display-friendly version of the path to the moved file or folder, preserving original casing.

properties.description: ID of the moved file or folder.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Name of the file with the extension. Don't fill in if you want a folder.
properties.label: Filename
properties.name: filename

properties.description: Path in the user's Dropbox to be moved.  Root is /.
properties.label: Source Path
properties.name: from_path

properties.description: Path in the user's Dropbox that is the destination. Root is /.
properties.label: Destination Path
properties.name: to_path

actions.title: Move

actions.description: Searches for files and folders. Can only be used to retrieve a maximum of 10,000 matches. Recent changes may not immediately be reflected in search results due to a short delay in indexing. Duplicate results may be returned across pages. Some results may not be returned.

properties.description: A list (possibly empty) of matches for the query.
The metadata for the matched file or folder.

properties.description: The name of the file or folder, including its extension. This is the last component of the path.

properties.description: The full path to the file or folder in lowercase, as stored in the user's Dropbox.

properties.description: The lowercased full path in the user's Dropbox.
properties.name: path_lower

properties.description: The cased path to be used for display purposes only.
properties.name: path_display

properties.description: ID of the folder.

properties.description: The file size in bytes.

properties.description: If file can be downloaded directly.
properties.name: is_downloadable

properties.description: A hash of the file content.
properties.name: content_hash

properties.description: The object property which contains a reference to the file to be written.
properties.label: File Entry
properties.name: fileEntry

properties.description: The path to which the file should be written.
properties.label: Destination Path
properties.name: path

properties.description: Name of the file. Needs to have the appropriate extension.
properties.label: Filename
properties.name: filename

properties.description: If there's a conflict, as determined by mode, have the Dropbox server try to autorename the file to avoid conflict.
properties.label: Auto Rename
properties.name: autorename

properties.description: Normally, users are made aware of any file modifications in their Dropbox account via notifications in the client software. If true, this tells the clients that this modification shouldn't result in a user notification.
properties.label: Mute
properties.name: mute

properties.description: Be more strict about how each WriteMode detects conflict. For example, always return a conflict error when mode = WriteMode.update and the given "rev" doesn't match the existing file's "rev", even if the existing file has been deleted.
properties.label: Strict Conflict
properties.name: strict_conflict
